result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke A Hughey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Luke A Hughey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Luke A Hughey was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber revoked and loss of 5 days good time due to jail violations.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Luke A Hughey in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 7 months jail, consecutive to any previously-imposed sentences, start May 26, 2015 at 7 p.m. Maintain absolute sobriety during stay of sentence. Huber granted under jail rules. $518 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. Ct. 3 dismissed out right.
